course.subject: ENVR
course.name: Material and Energy Balance for Environmental Management
course.description: Material and energy balance provides a quantitative account for materials and/or energy redistribution when changes happen. It is a tool which can be used to predict or solve practical problems like pollution control and management, product life-cycle analysis and management of resources (e.g. energy, food and water) for sustainable development. This course will introduce students to the fundamental principles of material and energy balance as applicable to environmental management. Covered topics include pollution control and treatment and industrial/building energy management. For EVMT students only.
course.exclusions: CENG 2010, CENG 2110

reviews.author: Orange_C
reviews.title: Flawed teaching comes from flawed course design
reviews.comment_content: "Material and Energy Balance" is a very important part for EVMT, and it should be taught systematically in a standardized way. Since I am taking Thermodynamics MECH2310 as well, I can clearly feel that the content of the course is put together from a very large variety of topics in a way that makes it really difficult to understand the principles. I know that the aim of this course is to provide EVMT students with basic but useful knowledge of the whole "Material and Energy" field, but I don't think this is successful.
reviews.comment_teaching: Actually, the professor has quite solid knowledge on this field and you can see he is trying his best to deliver and accommodate our needs because he often asks us about what our concerns are and adjust his teaching plans. However, as this professor is new to this course, he does not quite know how to teach in a way that makes undergraduate students without a lot of science background understand all those diagrams and processes.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is the best part of the course, I should say. Final 1 SD higher than mean, which is around 60(btw SD is so big, nearly 30), Assignment around mean, you have A range. However, the grading scheme keeps changing until 2 weeks before the final exam, the project, which is supposed to account for around 30%, is canceled abruptly without any prior notice. This is indeed very annoying because you will treat the assignment differently when it takes up 15 percent instead of 5 percent of your grading.
reviews.comment_workload: Only three short assignments throughout the whole semester. (There are supposed to be more, i.e. one more assignment and one whole group project, but they are canceled) To be fair, as a course that emphasizes material and energy balance, these three assignments are not enough to enhance our understanding.

reviews.author: envrdick
reviews.title: new professor, bad professor
reviews.comment_content:
This course is mainly about material and energy balance, you will need some basic physics and chemistry knowledge in order to understand the course materials (even though DSE-level physics and chemistry background is enough)
The lecture powerpoint is super messy and sometimes you cannot even find the answer key of a difficult question. Even if you find one, you wouldn't know what is it talking about and the calculations are hard to understand.
Some topics covered are:
- Energy balance
- Material balance
- Types of energy
- Enthalpy
- Change of state
- Ideal gas law
- Heat exchanger
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is just a mess. In the start of the semester, the professor always talks about the good of Excel and hard sell it to the class, I won't trust you if you say he is not the spokesperson of Microsoft. He is trying to build up a calculating mind of his own on all of us, and always make the calculations extremely complicated even though it is an easy one. The most important thing is that he needs us to follow his calculation steps even though we are more familiar with ours. I could say if you do not have a chemistry or physics background, you will not be able to follow his words, even if you have, you will think quite hard to understand his teaching. The course itself is not difficult but the professor makes it complicated, it will be much much better if the course is taught by others
reviews.comment_grading: mean marks of assignments are high as classmates are just copying from each other
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 3 assignments (50%) and 1 final exam (50%) during the whole semester. But don't trust the professor about the exam scope, he will definitely set some questions that you did not encounter during the whole course. Originally the professor sets four assignments and one group project and one final exam, but he keeps changing his plan and we didn't know that the group project is cancelled until the last few weeks of the whole semester.
For the assignment, the professor needs us to deal with the questions using Excel, and it is easy to copy your classmate's work. In fact, many classmates just copying from each other so you could only see a few versions of answers. for the assignment questions, you can refer to the lecture powerpoint but you will feel hopeless when you try to do it because you will not be able to find the method of dealing with some of the questions in the powerpoint. Also, in some questions, you will need to refer to some numbers or data, but the professor just gives you the link to a certain website and ask you to find it by yourselves. However, you cannot find some data on the given website, so what you can do? Yes, copying from your classmates.
For the final exam, there are only 5 questions and they are tricky. One unacceptable thing is that the professor didn't provide us with crucial data in calculating one of the questions and he could only realise it on hour after the start of the exam. That moment some students left already and they definitely will lose marks due to the professor's mistake.

You can always ask others to teach you how to do those assignments and get a high score.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Despite useful topics, Terrence's teaching method is quite traditional. He mostly explain the concepts through rather plain powerpoint and one-way communication. However, he likes to repeat the concepts so the whole class will understand.

Tip: If you really dont understand, find Xue Ba or find terrence directly after class. He is willing to anser your questions anytime.
reviews.comment_grading:
I can't say for sure with the grading. Some got really good grades and some got terrible grades.

For me, i think the grading is pretty lenient. At least he didn't fail anyone :p
Assignments (~90%)
Midterm (79/100) m: 56
Project (82/100) m: 78
Final Exam (100/150) m: 86

Final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
There is an assignment every 2 weeks and a group project at the final month. The assignments might be hard so YOU ARE ENCOURAGED to discuss with your classmates! As for the group project, make sure to pick a topic you are interested or else you will suffer during the report writing and presentation.

For me, the workload is very acceptable for a 3-credit course.
